page.title: List of international presidential trips made by François Hollande

revision.comment: Moving from [[Category:Diplomatic visits by heads of state]] to [[Category:Lists of diplomatic visits by heads of state]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
[[File:List of presidential trips made by François Hollande.svg|thumb|380px|Map of international trips made by François Hollande as president: {{legend|#a1a7ef|1 visit}} {{legend|#737ce8|2 visits}} {{legend|#4f5ae3|3 visits}} {{legend|#2533dd|4 visits}} {{legend|#1a25ac|5 visits}} {{legend|#111976|6 visits}} {{legend|#050725|7 or more visits}} {{legend|#000000|France and Andorra}}]] This is a '''list of international presidential trips made by François Hollande''', the [[List of Presidents of France|24th]] [[President of France|President]] of [[France]]. During his presidency, which began with his [[French presidential inauguration|inauguration]] on 15 May 2012 and ended with the inauguration of [[Emmanuel Macron]] on 14 May 2017, [[François Hollande]] made 183 presidential trips to 83 states internationally. The number of visits per country where he travelled are: * One visit to [[Afghanistan]], [[Angola]], [[Argentina]], [[Belarus]], [[Benin]], [[Cameroon]], [[Canada]], [[Chad]], [[Chile]], [[Colombia]], [[Comoros]], [[Cuba]], [[Cyprus]], [[Czech Republic]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], [[Ethiopia]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], [[Guinea]], [[Haiti]], [[Iceland]], [[Indonesia]], [[Ireland]], [[Ivory Coast|Ivory Coast (Côte d'Ivoire)]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Laos]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Madagascar]], [[Malaysia]], [[Monaco]], [[Niger]], [[Norway]], [[State of Palestine|Palestine]], [[Peru]], [[Philippines]], [[Romania]], [[Singapore]], [[Slovenia]], [[South Korea]], [[Turkey]], [[Ukraine]], [[Uruguay]] and [[Vietnam]] * Two visits to [[Algeria]], [[Armenia]], [[Australia]], [[Azerbaijan]], [[Egypt]], [[India]], [[Iraq]], [[Israel]], [[Japan]], [[Jordan]], [[Lebanon]], [[Mexico]], [[Netherlands]], [[Nigeria]], [[Portugal]], [[Qatar]], [[Senegal]], [[South Africa]], [[United Arab Emirates]] and [[Vatican City]] * Three visits to [[Brazil]], the [[Central African Republic]], [[China]], [[Greece]], [[Mali]], [[Morocco]], [[Slovakia]] and [[Tunisia]] * Four visits to [[Malta]], [[Saudi Arabia]] and [[Switzerland]] * Five visits to [[Russia]], [[Spain]] * Six visits to [[Poland]] and the [[United Kingdom]] * Eight visits to [[Italy]] * Ten visits to the [[United States]] * Twenty-two visits to [[Germany]] * Forty-two visits to [[Belgium]]
== 2012 == In his first year in office, President François Hollande made 25 international trips to 18 different countries. The following were the international trips made by the President in 2012: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|Germany}} [[Germany]] |[[Berlin]] |{{sort|2012-05-15|15 May}} |President Hollande's [[state visit]] to [[Germany]] was his first trip outside France as president. He chose Germany as the first foreign trip of his presidency in a demonstration of the historic and strategic ties between the two countries.<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2012/05/15/world/europe/france-hollande/index.html After meeting with Merkel, Hollande pushes for growth]</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|United States}} [[United States]] |[[Washington, D.C.]], [[Camp David]], [[Chicago]] |{{sort|2012-05-18|18–21 May}} |During President Hollande's first trip outside the [[Europe|European continent]], he met with the [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Barack Obama]] in [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]]. The two leaders said the [[European debt crisis]] was of great importance to the whole world. President Hollande said, "We have the same conviction that Greece must remain in the [[eurozone]]". They agreed on most views, except the withdrawal of [[French forces in Afghanistan|France's troops from Afghanistan]] at year's end.<ref>[https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/05/18/us-obama-hollande-idUSBRE84H17Y20120518 Obama, Hollande agree on much - but not Afghanistan]</ref> President Hollande later attended the [[38th G8 summit]] in Camp David and the [[2012 NATO summit]] in Chicago. |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2012-05-23|23 May}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend a [[European Union]] leaders summit, regarding the [[European debt crisis]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/24/business/global/stocks-fall-on-concerns-about-euro-zone-as-eu-leaders-gather.html?_r=1|title= European Stocks Stumble as Leaders Gather in Brussels|language=fr|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''|last=Jolly|first=David|date=23 May 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Afghanistan}} [[Afghanistan]] |[[Kabul]], [[Kapisa Province]] |{{sort|2012-05-25|25 May}} |For security reasons, this visit was unannounced. Hollande met with [[President of Afghanistan|Afghan President]] [[Hamid Karzai]] in [[Kabul]] and visited French soldiers at the [[Nijrab District|Nijrab]] base in the province of Kapisa where most French troops are based.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.de/dw/article/0,,15976461,00.html|title=Hollande defends early Afghanistan exit during surprise visit|date=25 May 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Rome]] |{{sort|2012-06-14|14 June}} |In Rome, President Hollande met with [[Prime Minister of Italy|Prime Minister]] [[Mario Monti]] to discuss the [[European debt President Hollande was joined by [[European Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]] [[José Manuel Barroso]], [[Italy|Italian]] [[Prime Minister of Italy|Prime Minister]] [[Mario Monti]], [[Libya]]n [[List of heads of state of Libya|President]] [[Mohammed Magariaf]], Maltese [[Prime Minister of Malta|Prime Minister]] [[Lawrence Gonzi]], [[Portugal|Portuguese]] [[Prime Minister of Portugal|Prime Minister]] [[Pedro Passos Coelho]], [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Prime Minister of Spain|Prime Minister]] [[Mariano Rajoy]], and [[Tunisia]]n [[President of Tunisia|President]] [[Moncef Marzouki]].<ref>{{cite news|title=EU, Maghreb leaders hold first summit since Arab Spring|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/10/06/242115.html|accessdate=13 March 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Al Arabiya]]''|date=6 October 2012|location=Valletta}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Micallef|first1=Mark|title=Francois Hollande to visit Malta|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20120905/local/hollande.435745|accessdate=13 March 2015|publisher=''[[Times of Malta]]''|date=5 September 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Senegal}} [[Senegal]] |[[Dakar]] |{{sort|2012-10-12|12 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Senegal on his first visit to the [[Africa|African continent]] as president "to write a new page in France's relations with Africa." In Dakar, President Hollande met with [[President of Senegal|President]] [[Macky Sall]]. The president also addressed the [[National Assembly (Senegal)|National Assembly]] and visited the [[House of Slaves (Gorée)|House of Slaves]] on [[Gorée]].<ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande praises Senegal in first Africa visit|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/oct/12/francois-holland-senegal-africa-visit|accessdate=13 March 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=12 October 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Democratic Republic of Congo}} [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] |[[Kinshasa]] |{{sort|2012-10-13|13 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Kinshasa to attend the [[Organisation internationale de la Francophonie#Summits|Francophonie Summit]], where he, along with [[Canada|Canadian]] [[Prime Minister of Canada|Prime Minister]] [[Stephen Harper]], urged leaders to strengthen [[democracy]] and [[human rights]]. President Hollande met with [[President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|President]] [[Joseph Kabila]] and opposition leader [[Étienne Tshisekedi]] of the [[Union for Democracy and Social Progress (Democratic Republic of the Congo)|Union for Democracy and Social Progress]] to discuss internal issues.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hogg|first1=Jonny|last2=Pineau|first2=Elizabeth|title=France, Canada focus attention on Congo rights record|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/10/13/us-congo-democratic-rights-idUSBRE89C0HV20121013|accessdate=13 March 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=13 October 2012|location=Kinshasa}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Gouby|first1=Melanie|title=French president commits to exchange in Congo|url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2012/oct/13/french-president-commits-to-exchange-in-congo/|accessdate=13 March 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[U-T San Diego]]''|date=13 October 2012|location=Kinshasa}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2012-10-18|18–19 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend a [[European Council]], focused on economic policy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://register.consilium.europa.eu/doc/srv?l=EN&f=ST%20156%202012%20INIT|title=EUROPEAN COUNCIL 18/19 OCTOBER 2012 CONCLUSIONS}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Lebanon}} [[Lebanon]] |[[Beirut]] |rowspan=2| {{sort|2012-11-04|4 November}} |President Hollande paid a three-hour visit to Beirut to meet with [[President of Lebanon|President]] [[Michel Suleiman]] at the [[Baabda Palace]]. The President shared France and the [[European Union]]'s support against the instability in Lebanon, in light of the [[Assassination of Wissam al-Hassan|assassination]] of intelligence official [[Wissam al-Hassan]], which caused tensions between pro- and anti-Syrian groups.<ref name="Lebanon-Saudi Arabia">{{cite news|title=French president discusses Syria, Iran in Saudi Arabia|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/11/04/247637.html|accessdate=14 March 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Al Arabiya]]''|date=4 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=France's Hollande pledges to stand against instability in Lebanon|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/france-s-hollande-pledges-to-stand-against-instability-in-lebanon-1.475093|accessdate=14 March 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Haaretz]]''|date=4 November 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Saudi Arabia}} [[Saudi Arabia]] |[[Jeddah]] |After a brief visit to Beirut, President Hollande headed to Jeddah in order to meet with [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah]] and to improve bilateral relations between France and Saudi Arabia. The two [[Head of state|heads of state]] discussed the [[Iran]]ian [[Nuclear program of Iran|nuclear program]], the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]], the [[Syrian Civil War]], and the cooperation between the two countries.<ref name="Lebanon-Saudi Arabia"/><ref>{{cite news|title=France's Hollande discusses Syria, Iran in Saudi|url=http://www.nation.co.ke/news/world/Frances-Hollande-discusses-Syria-Iran/-/1068/1611680/-/2afs8oz/-/index.html|accessdate=14 March 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Daily Nation]]''|date=5 November 2012|location=Jeddah}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Laos}} [[Laos]] |[[Vientiane]] |{{sort|2012-11-05|5 November}} |President Hollande attended the 9th [[Asia–Europe Meeting]] in Vientiane. Prior to the summit, President Hollande met with [[President of Laos|President]] [[Choummaly Sayasone]] at the [[Presidential Palace (Laos)|Presidential Palace]].<ref>{{cite web|title=France/Laos|url=http://www.ambafrance-us.org/spip.php?article4063|publisher=[[Embassy of France, Washington, D.C.]]|accessdate=7 February 2015|date=5 November 2012}}</ref> President Hollande also held talks with [[China|Chinese]] [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] [[Wen Jiabao]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Zhang|first1=Dan|title=Wen Jiabao meets Hollande on bilateral ties in Laos|url=http://english.cntv.cn/program/asiatoday/20121106/102754.shtml|accessdate=7 February 2015|publisher=''[[CCTV News]]''|date=6 November 2012}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Warsaw]] |{{sort|2012-11-16|16 November}} |On 16 November, President Hollande travelled to Warsaw for an official visit, where he met with [[President of Poland|President]] [[Bronisław Komorowski]] at the [[Presidential Palace, Warsaw|Presidential Palace]] to discuss the [[Budget of the European Union#The EU budget for 2014–2020|budget of the European Union for 2014–2020]], economic relations between France and Poland, and the collaboration between the "[[Weimar Triangle]]" countries (France, Germany, and Poland). President Hollande later laid a wreath at the [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Warsaw|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], participated in the Polish-French Economic Forum at the [[Copernicus Science Centre]], and addressed the [[Sejm]]. Back at the Presidential Palace, President Hollande was hosted by President Komorowski and [[First Lady of Poland|First Lady]] [[Anna Komorowska]] for an official dinner. President Hollande also met with [[Prime Minister of Poland|Prime Minister]] [[Donald Tusk]].<ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande to arrive in Warsaw for EU, trade talks|url=http://www.thenews.pl/1/12/Artykul/118598,Fran%C3%A7ois-Hollande-to-arrive-in-Warsaw-for-EU-trade-talks|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[Polskie Radio]]''|date=16 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=President Hollande to visit Poland on Friday|url=http://www.visegradgroup.eu/news/president-hollande-to|publisher=[[Visegrád Group#International Visegrád Fund|International Visegrád Fund]]|accessdate=26 January 2015|date=15 November 2012}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2012-11-22|22–23 November}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend an "extraordinary" [[European Council]], focused on [[Budget of the European Union|EU budget]] and the European debt crisis.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2012/nov/23/eurozone-crisis-eu-budget-summit-cameron|title=David Cameron blasts EU as budget summit ends without a deal}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Norway}} [[Norway]] |[[Oslo]] |{{sort|2012-12-10|10 December}} |President Hollande attended the [[2012 Nobel Peace Prize]] [[Nobel Prize#Award ceremonies|award ceremony]] at the [[Oslo City Hall]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Plunkett|first1=Suzanne|title=Preisverleihung in Oslo|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/politik/ausland/article111925237/Preisverleihung-in-Oslo.html|accessdate=14 March 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|publisher=''[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]''|date=10 December 2012|language=German}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2012-12-13|13–14 December}} |President Hollande attended the [[European Council]], focused on [[Economic and Monetary Union of the European Union|Economic and Monetary Union]] regulations and growth mechanisms.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-205-2012-INIT/en/pdf|title=EUROPEAN COUNCIL 13/14 DECEMBER 2012 CONCLUSIONS}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Algeria}} [[Algeria]] |[[Algiers]], [[Tlemcen]] |{{sort|2012-12-19|19–20 December}} |President Hollande travelled to Algiers on a state visit to improve relations between Algeria and France in the commemoration of the semicentennial anniversary of Algeria's independence from France. Upon arrival on 19 December, the President was greeted by [[President of Algeria|President]] [[Abdelaziz Bouteflika]], who joined him in an open motorcade through the streets of Algiers. The two presidents agreed on opening a "new era" in the two countries' bilateral relations that would increase cooperation and trade. President Hollande met with the French community, before attending a [[state dinner]] hosted by President Bouteflika at the [[El Mouradia]]. On 20 December, President Hollande addressed the [[Parliament of Algeria]],<ref>{{cite news|title=President Hollande accepts French injustice in Algeria|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-20795750|accessdate=14 March 2015|publisher=''[[BBC News]]''|date=20 December 2012}}</ref> before delivering a speech at the [[University of Abou Bekr Belkaïd]] in Tlemcen.<ref>{{cite web|title=Déplacement du Président de la République en Algérie|url=http://www.elysee.fr/communiques-de-presse/article/deplacement-du-president-de-la-republique-en-algerie/|publisher=[[Élysée Palace]]|accessdate=14 March 2015|language=French|date=11 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande says no apology for Algerian colonial past|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20121219-france-hollande-refuses-apologise-algeria-colonial-past/|accessdate=14 March 2015|publisher=''[[France 24]]''|date=19 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande acknowledges Algerian suffering under French rule|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/dec/20/francois-hollande-algerian-suffering-french|accessdate=14 March 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=20 December 2012}}</ref> |}
== 2013 == In 2013, President François Hollande made 34 international trips to 28 different countries. The following were the international trips made by President Hollande during the year: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flag|United Arab Emirates}} |[[Abu Dhabi]], [[Dubai]] |{{sort|2013-01-15|15 January}} |President Hollande travelled to the United Arab Emirates for a one-day visit. In Abu Dhabi, President Hollande delivered a keynote speech at the [[World Future Energy Summit]]<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rowdybush|first1=Brinton|title=France's Hollande Seeks to Build Upon Expanding Ties With the UAE|url=http://www.worldpoliticsreview.com/articles/12686/frances-hollande-seeks-to-build-upon-expanding-ties-with-the-uae|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''World Politics Review''|date=4 February 2013}}</ref> and met with [[President of the United Arab Emirates|President]] [[Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] to discuss the United Arab Emirates' possible purchase of the [[Dassault Rafale]] fighter jets,<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande: UAE Rafale jet deal contingent on price|url=http://www.saudigazette.com.sa/index.cfm?method=home.regcon&contentid=20130116149415|accessdate=29 November 2014|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Saudi Gazette]]''|date=16 On 14 February, in New Delhi, President Hollande visited the [[Rashtrapati Bhavan]] and the [[Raj Ghat and associated memorials|Raj Ghat]], before meeting with [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Manmohan Singh]] and [[Minister of External Affairs (India)|External Affairs Minister]] [[Salman Khurshid]]. The following day, he delivered a lecture at the [[Nehru Memorial Museum & Library]] in the [[Teen Murti Bhavan]], the former residence of [[Jawaharlal Nehru]], the first Indian Prime Minister. President Hollande also awarded economist and philosopher [[Amartya Sen]] with the [[Legion of Honour]]. Afterwards, President Hollande travelled to Mumbai where he met with [[List of Governors of Maharashtra|Governor]] [[Kateekal Sankaranarayanan]] and attended a business conference.<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Francois Hollande to honour Amartya Sen during India visit|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/french-president-francois-hollande-to-honour-amartya-sen-during-india-visit/372189-3.html|accessdate=26 January 2015|agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service]]|publisher=''[[CNN-IBN]]''|date=11 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=State Visit of President of France to India, February 14-15, 2013|url=http://mea.gov.in/press-releases.htm?dtl/21156/State+Visit+of+President+of+France+to+India+February+1415+2013|publisher=[[Ministry of External Affairs (India)]]|accessdate=26 January 2015|location=New Delhi|date=9 February 2013}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Greece}} |[[Athens]] |{{sort|2013-02-19|19 February}} |President Hollande paid an official visit to Athens to promote the investment of French companies to [[Economy of Greece|Greece's economy]], affected by the [[Greek government-debt crisis]]. President Hollande met with [[Prime Minister of Greece|Prime Minister]] [[Antonis Samaras]], [[President of Greece|President]] [[Karolos Papoulias]], and [[Deputy Prime Minister of Greece|Deputy Prime Minister]] [[Evangelos Venizelos]]. He also addressed a meeting with heads of Greek companies.<ref>{{cite news|title=On Athens visit, Hollande pledges to 'mobilize' French investment in Greece|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_20/02/2013_483691|accessdate=29 November 2014|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Kathimerini]]''|date=20 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Helena|title=François Hollande turns up the warm message of support for Greece|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/feb/19/francois-hollande-message-support-greece|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=19 February 2013|location=[[Athens]], [[Greece]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Kitsantonis|first1=Niki|title=Hollande Visits Greece to Show Support for Recovery Efforts|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/20/business/global/hollande-visits-greece-to-show-support-for-recovery-efforts.html?_r=0|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''|date=19 February 2013|location=[[Athens]], [[Greece]]}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Russia}} |[[Moscow]] |{{sort|2013-02-27|27–28 February}} |President Hollande travelled to Moscow for a two-day visit, where he met with [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]]. Rohani|language=french|publisher=Le Parisien|accessdate=4 May 2015}}</ref> |- |{{flag|South Africa}} |[[Pretoria]], [[Johannesburg]] |{{sort|2013-10-14|14–15 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Pretoria on a state visit to South Africa, where he met with [[President of South Africa|President]] [[Jacob Zuma]] at the [[Union Buildings]]. The two presidents held a bilateral meeting, discussing political and economic ties, followed by a joint press conference. President Hollande later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at [[Freedom Park (South Africa)|Freedom Park]]. President Zuma also hosted a state banquet for President Hollande at the [[Mahlamba Ndlopfu]].
On his second day, President Hollande met with [[Deputy President of South Africa|Deputy President]] [[Kgalema Motlanthe]]. He also visited a [[Sanofi]] production plant in [[Mamelodi]], visited [[HIV/AIDS]] organizations, and visited the [[Hector Pieterson Museum]] and the [[Mandela House]] in [[Soweto]], upon travelling to [[Johannesburg]]. President Hollande also visited the Nelson Mandela Foundation, where he met with [[Graça Machel]], the wife of former President [[Nelson Mandela]]. Before flying home, President Hollande met with a French community.<ref>{{cite web|title=François Hollande’s visit to South Africa|url=http://www.ambafrance-rsa.org/Francois-Hollande-s-visit-to-South|publisher=French Embassy, Pretoria|accessdate=29 November 2014|date=16 July 2014}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2013-10-24|24–25 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend a [[European Council]], focused on the [[digital economy]] and [[Banking union|union banking]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-169-2013-INIT/en/pdf|title=EUROPEAN COUNCIL 24/25 OCTOBER 2013 CONCLUSIONS}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Slovakia}} |[[Bratislava]] |{{sort|2013-10-29|29 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Bratislava to highlight the 20 years of Slovakia's [[dissolution of Czechoslovakia|independence]], becoming the first French president to visit to Slovakia as an independent sovereign state. In Bratislava, President Hollande met with [[President of Slovakia|President]] [[Ivan Gašparovič]], [[Prime Minister of Slovakia|Prime Minister]] [[Robert Fico]], and [[List of speakers of Slovak parliaments|Speaker]] [[Pavol Paška]] of the [[National Council (Slovakia)|National Council]], whom he met at the [[Bratislava Castle]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Vilikovská|first1=Zuzana|title=Hollande pays historic visit to Slovakia|url=http://spectator.sme.sk/articles/view/51859/10/hollande_pays_historic_visit_to_slovakia.html|accessdate=29 November 2014|agency=Flash News|publisher=''[[The Slovak Spectator]]''|date=30 October 2013}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Monaco}} |[[Monaco]] |{{sort|2013-11-14|14 November}} |President Hollande paid an official visit to Monaco, where he met with [[Albert II, Prince of Monaco]]. The two held a bilateral meeting at the [[Prince's Palace of Monaco]] and signed five partnership agreements for scientific and environmental research at the [[Oceanographic Museum]]. The two also visited the workshops of [[Venturi Automobiles]] and offices of the Scientific Centre of Monaco.<ref>{{cite web|title=Official visit to the Principality by Mr François Hollande, President of the French Republic|url=http://www.palais.mc/en/news/h-s-h-prince-albert-ii/event/2013/november/official-visit-to-the-principality-by-mr-francois-hollande-president-of-the-french-republic-3092.html|publisher=[[Prince's Palace of Monaco]] ''(Palais Princier de Monaco)''|accessdate=27 November 2014|date=8 November 2013}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Israel}}<br />{{flag|State of Palestine}} |[[Tel Aviv]], [[Jerusalem]], [[Ramallah]] |{{sort|2013-11-17|17–19 November}} |On 17 November, President Hollande travelled to Tel Aviv for a state visit to Israel, where he was welcomed by [[President of Israel|President]] [[Shimon Peres]] and [[Prime Minister of Israel|Prime Minister]] [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] at [[Ben Gurion Airport]]. President Hollande and President Peres discussed the [[nuclear program of Iran]] and the [[2013–14 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks|Israeli–Palestinian peace talks]] at [[Beit HaNassi]]. President Hollande then met with Prime Minister Netanyahu, holding a joint press conference and signing bilateral cooperation agreements. President Hollande also visited [[Yad Vashem]].
On 18 November, President Hollande visited [[St Anne's Church, Jerusalem|St Anne's Church]], before visiting the Palestinian city of Ramallah in the [[West Bank]]. In Ramallah, he laid a wreath at the burial site of former Palestinian leader [[Yasser Arafat]], then met with [[President of the Palestinian National Authority|President]] [[Mahmoud Abbas]], before returning to Jerusalem.<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Hollande visits Israel and Palestinian territories|url=http://www.upi.com/News_Photos/News/French-President-Hollande-visits-Israel-and-Palestinian-territories/fp/8010/|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[United Press International]]''}}</ref> In Jerusalem, President Hollande addressed the [[Knesset]] at a special session, then attended a state dinner hosted by President Peres.
On 19 November, President Hollande visited the graves of the victims of the [[Toulouse and Montauban shootings]] in March 2012. He then toured an Israeli innovation exhibit, before returning to France.<ref>{{cite web|title=French President Hollande on state visit to Israel|url=http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/PressRoom/2013/Pages/French-President-Hollande-visit-Israel-17-Nov-2013.aspx|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Israel)]]|accessdate=29 November 2014|date=18 African Republic as Hollande visits|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/10/us-centralafrican-france-idUSBRE9B80O320131210|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[Reuters]]''|date=10 December 2013|location=[[Bangui]], [[Central African Republic]]}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Brazil}} |[[Brasília]], [[São Paulo]] |{{sort|2013-12-12|12–13 December}} |President Hollande travelled on a state visit to Brazil in order to increase trade and strengthen the [[strategic partnership]] between Brazil and France. In Brasília, President Hollande met with [[President of Brazil|President]] [[Dilma Rousseff]] at the [[Palácio do Planalto]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande on Brazil visit urges doubling two-way trade|url=http://www.i24news.tv/en/news/international/131213-hollande-on-brazil-visit-urges-doubling-two-way-trade|accessdate=30 January 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[i24news]]''|date=13 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Francois Hollande in Brazil to ramp up ties|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-1-219895-Francois-Hollande-in-Brazil-to-ramp-up-ties|accessdate=30 January 2015|publisher=''[[The News International]]''|date=13 December 2013|location=Brasília}}</ref> He also participated in the Brazil–France High Level Dialogue on Education at the [[Cultural Complex of the Republic#National Museum of the Republic|National Museum of the Republic]], before heading to São Paulo. In São Paulo, President Hollande and President Rousseff met with business leaders at the [[Federação das Indústrias do Estado de São Paulo]].<ref>{{cite web|title=State Visit of the President of the French Republic, François Hollande|url=http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=3636:state-visit-of-the-president-of-the-french-republic,-fran%C3%A7ois-hollande&catid=42&lang=en&Itemid=478|publisher=[[Ministry of External Relations (Brazil)]]|accessdate=30 January 2015|date=21 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Lehman|first1=Stan|title=French and Brazil presidents want free trade zone|url=http://ojornal.com/portuguese-brazilian-news/2013/12/french-and-brazil-presidents-want-free-trade-zone/#axzz3QJ1UlTYl|accessdate=30 January 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''OJornal''|date=13 December 2013|location=São Paulo}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2013-12-19|19–20 December}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend a [[European Council]], focused on Ukraine and [[Common Security and Defence Policy|defence]], [[Economy of the European Union|economic]], and social policies, as well as [[Immigration to Europe|migration flows]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-217-2013-INIT/en/pdf|title=EUROPEAN COUNCIL 19/20 DECEMBER 2013 CONCLUSIONS}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Saudi Arabia}} [[Saudi Arabia]] |[[Riyadh]] |{{sort|2013-12-29|29–30 December}} |President Hollande paid a two-day state visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia focused on the [[List of modern conflicts in the Middle East|Middle Eastern crisis]] and commercial cooperation.<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Hollande tackles Middle Eastern crises on Saudi visit|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/kt-article-display-1.asp?xfile=data/middleeast/2013/December/middleeast_December289.xml&section=middleeast|accessdate=4 May 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=Khaleej Times}}</ref> |}
== 2014 == [[File:State Visit of François Hollande.jpg|thumb|President François Hollande with [[United States]] [[President of the United States|President]] [[Barack Obama]] and [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] [[Michelle Obama]] at the [[White House]] during his [[state visit]] to [[Washington, D.C.]], 11 February 2014]] In 2014, President François Hollande made 30 international trips to 27 different countries. The following were the international trips made by President Hollande during the year: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flag|Netherlands}} |[[The Hague]] |{{sort|2014-01-20|20 January}} |President Hollande travelled to The Hague on a [[state visit]] to meet with [[Monarchy of the Netherlands|King]] [[Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands|Willem-Alexander]], [[Queen Máxima of the Netherlands|Queen Máxima]], and [[Prime Minister of the Netherlands|Prime Minister]] [[Mark Rutte]]. He also met with the [[House of Representatives (Netherlands)|House of Representatives]] and the [[Senate (Netherlands)|Senate]], where he addressed the diplomatic and political ties between the two countries.<ref>{{cite web|title=French President François Hollande visits Dutch Parliament|url=http://www.houseofrepresentatives.nl/news/french-president-fran%C3%A7ois-hollande-visits-dutch-parliament|publisher=[[House of Representatives (Netherlands)]]|accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Samuel|first1=Henry|title=François Hollande should stay 'a bachelor president', advisers say|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/10584055/Francois-Hollande-should-stay-a-bachelor-president-advisers-say.html|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''|date=20 January 2014|location=[[Paris]], [[France]]}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Vatican City}} |[[Vatican City]] |{{sort|2014-01-24|24 January}} |President Hollande met with [[Pope Francis]] during his visit to Vatican City. The two held private talks inside the [[Apostolic Palace]], where they discussed the [[Central African Republic conflict (2012–present)|Central African Republic conflict]], [[Christianity in the Middle East]], the [[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]], and the [[Syrian Civil War]].<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Francois Hollande meets Pope Francis at Vatican amid affair rumours|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/french-president-francois-hollande-meets-pope-francis-at-vatican-amid-affainewr-rumours/story-fndir2ev-1226810131079|accessdate=27 November 2014|agency=[[News.com.au]]|publisher=''[[News Corp Australia]]''|date=25 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Pineau|first1=Elizabeth|last2=Pullella|first2=Philip|title=France's Hollande makes delicate visit to Pope Francis|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/01/24/us-pope-hollande-idUSBREA0N11I20140124|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[Reuters]]''|date=24 January 2014|location=[[Vatican City]]}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Turkey}} |[[Ankara]], [[Istanbul]] |{{sort|2014-01-27|27–28 January}} |President Hollande travelled to Ankara on a [[state visit]] to meet with [[President of Turkey|President]] [[Abdullah Gül]]. A bilateral meeting was held for the two presidents, in which political and economic issues were discussed, as well as cooperation and partnership between the two countries.<ref>{{cite web|title=President Hollande of France pays a state visit to Turkey|url=http://www.mfa.gov.tr/president-hollande-of-france-pays-a-state-visit-to-turkey.en.mfa|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Turkey)]]|accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> He also attended a ceremony at the [[Anıtkabir]]. President Hollande then travelled to Istanbul, where he attended an economic forum with French and Turkish business leaders.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande in Turkey in bid to improve ties|url=http://www.english.rfi.fr/asia-pacific/20140127-hollande-turkey-bid-improve-ties|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[Radio France Internationale]]''|date=27 January 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|United Kingdom}} |[[London]] |{{sort|2014-01-31|31 January}} |President Hollande travelled to London to attend the UK-France Summit 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=UK-France Summit 2014|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-25973423|publisher=[[Government of the United Kingdom]]|accessdate=27 November 2014|date=31 January 2014}}</ref> He also met with [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[David Cameron]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Embattled French President Hollande visiting UK|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-25973423|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[BBC News]]''|date=31 January 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Tunisia}} |[[Tunis]] |{{sort|2014-02-07|7 February}} |President Hollande assisted to the presidential ceremony of the [[Tunisian Constitution of 2014]].<ref>{{cite news|title=TUNISIE. Hollande : la Constitution "fait honneur à votre révolution"|language=french|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/monde/20140207.OBS5465/francois-hollande-en-tunisie-pour-feter-la-nouvelle-constitution.html|accessdate=4 May 2015|publisher=L'Obs}}</ref> |- |{{flag|United States}} |[[Washington, D.C.]], [[Charlottesville]], [[San Francisco]] |{{sort|2014-02-10|10–12 February}} |President Hollande travelled to Washington, D.C. to meet with [[President of the United States|President]] [[Barack Obama]]. The two presidents travelled to the [[Monticello]] in Charlottesville on board the U.S. President's [[Air Force One]], the residence of the third President and [[Founding Fathers of the United States of America|Founding Father]] [[Thomas Jefferson]], who also served as a [[United States Ambassador to France|United States Minister to France]]. At the [[White House]], President Hollande and President Obama discussed the [[Economy of France]], the [[Eurozone]], and the [[comprehensive agreement on Iranian nuclear program]]. President Hollande also travelled to San Francisco to meet with chiefs in [[Silicon Valley]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Francois Hollande arrives in US for state visit to Obama|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-26130252|accessdate=26 November 2014|publisher=''[[BBC]]''|date=11 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=President Hollande’s State Visit to the United States|url=http://ambafrance-us.org/spip.php?article5072|publisher=[[Embassy of France, Washington, D.C.]]|accessdate=26 November 2014|date=19 February 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Nigeria}} |[[Abuja]] |{{sort|2014-02-27|27 February}} |During a one-day official visit to Nigeria, President Hollande attended the International Conference on Peace and Security and met with [[President of Nigeria|President]] [[Goodluck Jonathan]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Soldiers flee, 33 die in attacks in north Nigeria|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2569262/Soldiers-flee-33-die-attacks-north-Nigeria.html|accessdate=26 March 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=27 February 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Central African Republic}} |[[Bangui]] |{{sort|2014-02-28|28 February}} |President Hollande travelled to the Central African Republic for the second time within three months. In Bangui, he delivered a speech to French military personnel and met with acting [[President of the Central African Republic|President]] [[Catherine Samba-Panza]].<ref>{{cite news|title=French president visits troops in Central African Republic|url=http://www.dw.de/french-president-visits-troops-in-central-african-republic/a-17465447|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[Deutsche Welle]]''|date=28 February 2014}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-03-06|6 March}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend an "extraordinary summit" of the [[European Council]] on [[Ukraine]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/economie/20140305.OBS8641/ukraine-a-bruxelles-l-arsenal-de-sanctions-brandi-contre-poutine.html|title=Ukraine : à Bruxelles, l'arsenal de sanctions brandi contre Poutine|publisher=L'Obs|language=french|accessdate=4 May 2015}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-03-20|20–21 March}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend to the [[European Council]] which focused on [[Ukraine]], [[Energy policy in the European Union|energy]], and growth.<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-7-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref> |- |{{flag|Netherlands}} |[[The Hague]] |{{sort|2014-03-24|24 March}} |President Hollande travelled to The Hague for the [[2014 Nuclear Security Summit]].<ref>http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_STATEMENT-14-82_en.htm</ref> |- |{{flag|Mexico}} |[[Mexico City]], [[Querétaro]] |{{sort|2014-04-10|10–11 April}} |President Hollande met with [[President of Mexico|President]] [[Enrique Peña Nieto]] in Mexico City during his two-day [[state visit]] to Mexico. The two presidents signed bilateral agreements regarding several industries, including [[Aerospace manufacturer|aerospace]], [[Energy industry|energy]], [[Health care industry|health]], and [[Industrial technology|technology]]. He also met with a French community in Mexico City and toured the site of [[Airbus Helicopters]] in [[Querétaro]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Woo|first1=Courtney|title=French President Francois Hollande visits Querétaro site in Mexico|url=http://events.airbushelicopters.com/en/article/french-president-francois-hollande-visits-queretaro-site-mexico|publisher=[[Airbus Helicopters]]|accessdate=30 January 2015|date=14 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=French President Francois Hollande to Visit Mexico|url=http://www.aptn.com/8025701A003B2562/(httpBSEvents)/D4F4E9D6D3EB492880257CB60036F27B?OpenDocument|accessdate=30 January 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=10–11 April 2014|location=Mexico City}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande in Mexico to mend strained relations|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20140410-hollande-mexico-state-visit-cassez-france-pena-nieto/|accessdate=30 January 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[France 24]]''|date=10 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande treads delicately in Mexico after Trierweiler tweet|url=http://www.english.rfi.fr/americas/20140411-hollande-treads-delicately-mexico-after-trierweiler-tweet|accessdate=30 January 2015|publisher=''[[Radio France Internationale]]''|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Germany}} |[[Berlin]], [[Sassnitz]] |{{sort|2014-05-09|9–10 May}} |President Hollande visited Berlin to meet with [[Chancellor of Germany|Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]]. The two discussed the [[European Union]]'s decision on imposing sanctions on [[Russia]] due to its involvement in the [[2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine]]. President Hollande and Chancellor Merkel also toured the [[Baltic Sea]] on the MS ''Nordwind'' off the coast of [[Sassnitz]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jordans|first1=Frank|title=Ukraine, Alstom on agenda as Hollande meets Merkel|url=https://news.yahoo.com/ukraine-alstom-agenda-hollande-meets-merkel-102233738.html|accessdate=27 November 2014|agency=''[[Associated Press]]''|publisher=''[[Yahoo! News]]''|date=9 May 2014|location=[[Berlin]], [[Germany]]}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Azerbaijan}} |[[Baku]] |{{sort|2014-05-11|11 May}} |President Hollande visited Baku for commercial discussions and exchanges of views around the [[Ukrainian crisis]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Ukraine : depuis Bakou, Hollande dénonce des référendums "nuls et non avenus"|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/international/francois-hollande-en-visite-dans-le-caucase-sur-fond-de-crise-ukrainienne-11-05-2014-3832243.php|accessdate=4 May 2015|publisher=Le Parisien}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Armenia}} |[[Yerevan]] |{{sort|2014-05-12|12–13 May}} |President Hollande travelled to Yerevan to pay a two-day [[state visit]], where he met with [[President of Armenia|President]] [[Serzh Sargsyan]]. He then attended the Armenian-French Business Forum, visited the construction site of a [[Carrefour]] store, inaugurated the [[Missak Manouchian]] Park in Yerevan, and met with a French community at the [[List of diplomatic missions of France|Embassy of France]] in Yerevan, and attended a concert by French-Armenian singer [[Charles Aznavour]] at the [[Karen Demirchyan Complex]]. President Sargsyan also hosted a [[state dinner]] for President Hollande at the [[Presidential Palace, Yerevan|Presidential Palace]]. The following day, President Hollande visited [[Tsitsernakaberd]] in order to honor the victims of the [[Armenian Genocide]].<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Hollande arrives in Armenia & visits Dzidzernagapert|url=http://www.uacla.com/french-president-hollande-arrives-in-armenia-visits-dzidzernagapert.html|accessdate=31 January 2015|agency=[[Armenpress]]|publisher=United Armenian Council for the Commemoration of the Armenian Genocide - Los Angeles|date=12 May 2014|location=Yerevan}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Francois Hollande visits Armenia with official visit|url=http://www.times.am/?p=41872&l=en|accessdate=31 January 2015|publisher=''Times.am''|date=12 May 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Georgia}} |[[Tbilisi]] |{{sort|2014-05-13|13 May}} |President Hollande visited Tbilisi and showed support in the shadow of the [[Ukrainian crisis]].<ref>{{cite news|title=A Tbilissi, Hollande réitère le soutien de la France à la Géorgie|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/europe/article/2014/05/14/a-tbilissi-hollande-reitere-le-soutien-de-la-france-a-la-georgie_4416657_3214.html|accessdate=4 May 2015|publisher=Le Monde}}</ref> |- Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/politique/elections-europeennes-2014/20140526.OBS8570/hollande-et-l-europe-diner-de-sourds-ce-soir-a-bruxelles.html|title=Hollande et l'Europe : dîner de sourds ce mardi soir à Bruxelles|publisher=L'Obs|language=french|accessdate=4 May 2015}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Warsaw]] |{{sort|2014-06-04|4 June}} |President Hollande travelled to Warsaw to participate in the 25th anniversary of the Polish freedom.<ref>http://www.ambafrance-pl.org/Deplacement-en-Pologne-du</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-06-05|4–5 Putin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/world-news/leaders-plan-brussels-g7-in-june-instead-of-g8-in-sochi-30120833.html|title=Leaders plan Brussels G7 in June instead of G8 in Sochi|publisher=The Independent|accessdate=4 May 2015}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Ypres]], [[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-06-26|26–27 June}} |President Hollande travelled to Ypres and Brussels in order to attend to the [[European Council]] which focused once again on [[Ukraine]], energy, and growth. [[Jean-Claude Juncker]] was designated as new [[President of the European Commission]].<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-79-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-07-16|16 July}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend to the extraordinary [[European Council]] on strategic agenda for 2014 with [[Jean-Claude Juncker]], the new [[President of the European Commission]], and on situations in [[Ukrainian crisis|Ukraine]] and the [[2014 Israel–Gaza conflict]].<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-147-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref> |- |{{flag|Ivory Coast}} |[[Abidjan]] |{{sort|2014-07-17|17 July}} |President Hollande travelled to Abidjan to meet with [[List of heads of state of Ivory Coast|President]] [[Alassane Ouattara]]. He also met with [[List of heads of state of Chad|President]] [[Idriss Déby]].<ref name="Africa"/><ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande in Chad ahead of Sahel anti-jihadi base launch|url=http://www.english.rfi.fr/africa/20140719-hollande-chad-ahead-sahel-anti-jihadi-base-launch|accessdate=29 November 2014|publisher=''[[Radio France Internationale]]''|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Liège]] |{{sort|2014-08-04|4 August}} |President Hollande travelled to Liège for the commemoration of the 100th anniversary of [[World War I]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sudinfo.be/1070719/article/2014-08-04/voici-le-programme-des-commemorations-de-la-1re-guerre-mondiale-a-liege-et-mons|language=french|accessdate=4 May 2015|title=Voici le programme des commémorations de la 1re Guerre Mondiale à Liège et Mons: Kate, William et François Hollande présents!|publisher=Sud Info}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Comoros}} [[Comoros]] |[[Moroni, Comoros|Moroni]] |{{sort|2014-08-23|23 August}} |President Hollande travelled to Moroni for the 4th [[Indian Ocean Commission]] Summit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://reunion.la1ere.fr/2014/08/23/francois-hollande-preside-le-4eme-sommet-de-la-coi-ce-samedi-aux-comores-179920.html|language=french|accessdate=4 May 2015|title=François Hollande, préside le 4ème sommet de la COI, ce samedi aux Comores|publisher=La 1ere}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-08-30|30 August}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend to the "extraordinary" [[European Council]], which appointed [[Donald Tusk]] as [[European Council]] [[President of the European Council|President]] and [[Federica Mogherini]] as [[High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy]]. Foreign affairs were particularly raised during this meeting.<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-163-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref> |- |{{flag|United Kingdom}} |[[Newport, Wales|Newport]] visit|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/francois-hollande/11091583/Francois-Hollande-bids-to-escape-domestic-trouble-with-Iraq-visit.html|accessdate=26 November 2014|publisher=''[[The Baghdad|url=http://www.dw.de/french-president-hollande-visits-baghdad/a-17917430|accessdate=26 November 2014|publisher=''[[Deutsche Welle]]''|date=12 September 2014}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|United China]]|date=17 October 2014|location=Milan}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-10-23|23–24 October}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend the [[European Council]] which focused on climate, the [[Ebola virus disease|Ebola virus]] [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa|epidemic in West Africa]], and [[Ukraine]].<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-169-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref><ref>http://www.consilium.europa.eu/uedocs/cms_data/docs/pressdata/en/ec/145444.pdf</ref> |- |{{flag|Canada}} |[[Calgary]], [[Banff, Alberta|Banff]], [[Montreal]], [[Quebec City]], [[Ottawa]] |{{sort|2014-11-02|2–4 November}} |President Hollande travelled to Canada for a state visit. On Sunday, 2 November, he arrived in Calgary, where he met with [[Prime Minister of Canada|Prime Minister]] [[Stephen Harper]], both of whom then travelled to the [[Banff National Park]] in [[Banff, Alberta|Banff]]. In Banff, a state dinner was held by [[Governor General of Canada|Governor General]] [[David Johnston]]. President Hollande and Prime Minister Harper also discussed international security, trade and economic development, innovation, and the ties between their peoples.<ref>{{cite news|author1=''[[The Canadian Press]]''|title=Francois Hollande, French president, makes 1st official visit to Western Canada|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/francois-hollande-french-president-makes-1st-official-visit-to-western-canada-1.2821267|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[CBC News]]''|date=2 November 2014}}</ref> On Monday, 3 November, President Hollande addressed the [[Parliament of Canada]] in Ottawa, where he addressed environmental issues regarding [[climate change]]. On Tuesday, 4 November, President Hollande visited Quebec City, where he addressed the [[National Assembly of Quebec]], before travelling to Montreal.<ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande says Quebec, France must invest in future partnership|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/fran%C3%A7ois-hollande-says-quebec-france-must-invest-in-future-partnership-1.2822908|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[CBC News]]''|date=4 November 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Australia}} |[[Brisbane]] |{{sort|2014-11-15|15–16 November}} |On 15 and 16 November, President Hollande travelled to Brisbane to attend the [[2014 G-20 Brisbane summit]], becoming the first French president to visit Australia. |- |{{flag|Australia}} |[[Canberra]], [[Sydney]] |{{sort|2014-11-18|18–19 November}} |On 18 and 19 November, President Hollande travelled to Canberra and Sydney, returning to Australia for a state visit after a visit to the French [[overseas collectivity]] of [[New Caledonia]].
In Sydney, President Hollande, along with [[President of French Polynesia|President]] [[Édouard Fritch]] of the [[French Polynesia]] and [[President of the Government of New Caledonia|President]] [[Harold Martin (New Caledonian politician)|Harold Martin]] of New Caledonia, were welcomed by [[Governor-General of Australia|Governor-General]] [[Peter Cosgrove]] at the [[Admiralty House, Sydney|Admiralty House]]. He later visited the [[Thales Group]] in [[Rydalmere, New South Wales|Rydalmere]] and delivered speeches to [[New South Wales]] [[Premier of New South Wales|Premier]] [[Mike Baird]] and the [[Business Council of Australia]] in [[Westpac]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dumas|first1=Daisy|title=Francois Hollande enjoys a Sydney welcome|url=http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/francois-hollande-enjoys-a-sydney-welcome-20141118-11p0zw.html|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]''|date=18 November 2014}}</ref>
In Canberra, President Hollande held bilateral talks with [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Tony Abbott]], which mainly focused on the relationship between Australia and France in [[World War I]]. President Hollande and Prime Minister Abbott also discussed intelligence cooperation and security issues, which included the [[2013–14 Ukrainian Crisis]], the [[territorial disputes in the South China Sea]], and the [[Syrian Civil War]]. The two later visited the [[Australian War Memorial]], where an [[oak tree]] was planted with soil coming from the [[Villers–Bretonneux Australian National Memorial]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lafargue|first1=Caroline|title=Francois Hollande in Australia: French president's visit sees Australia and France build relationship first forged in the mud of the Western Front|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-11-19/french-president-hollande-australia-wwi-sacrifice/5899058|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]]''|date=19 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Gul|first1=Jonathon|last2=Pianegonda|first2=Elise|title=French president Francois Hollande backs Australian military alliance and possible free trade deal|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-11-19/french-president-francoise-hollande-backs-military-alliance/5902746|accessdate=27 November 2014|publisher=''[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]]''|date=19 November 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Guinea}} |[[Conakry]] |{{sort|2014-11-28|28–29 November}} |{{see also|Responses to the Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa}} President Hollande paid an official visit to Conakry to devote France's proposition against the [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa]].<ref name="Guinea and Senegal">{{cite web|title=France takes action to combat Ebola|url=http://ambafrance-us.org/spip.php?article5998|publisher=[[Embassy of France, Washington, D.C.]]|accessdate=27 November 2014|date=21 November 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Senegal}} |[[Dakar]] |{{sort|2014-11-29|29–30 November}} |On 29 and 30 November, President Hollande paid an official visit to Dakar, where he attended the [[Organisation internationale de la Francophonie#Summits|Francophonie Summit]].<ref name="Guinea and Senegal"/> |- |{{flag|Kazakhstan}} |[[Astana]] |{{sort|2014-12-05|5–6 December}} |President Hollande travelled to Astana for a two-day visit in order to discuss [[human rights]] issues with [[President of Kazakhstan|President]] [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande in uranium-rich Kazakhstan to discuss contracts, relations with Russia|url=http://www.english.rfi.fr/asia-pacific/20141205-hollande-uranium-rich-kazakhstan-discuss-contracts-relations-russia|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[Radio France Internationale]]''|date=5 December 2014}}</ref> President Hollande also attended the inauguration of a [[Charles de Gaulle]] monument in Astana.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Satubaldina|first1=Assel|title=French President Francois Hollande to visit Kazakhstan in December|url=http://en.tengrinews.kz/politics_sub/French-President-Francois-Hollande-to-visit-Kazakhstan-in-December-257598/|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''TengriNews''|date=24 November 2014}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Russia}} |[[Moscow]] |{{sort|2014-12-06|6 December}} |Before returning to France, President Hollande paid an unscheduled visit to Moscow, where he met with [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] at Moscow's [[Vnukovo International Airport]] to discuss the [[2013–15 Ukrainian crisis|Ukrainian crisis]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hille|first1=Kathrin|last2=Thomson|first2=Adam|title=François Hollande meets Vladimir Putin in Moscow|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/49151cbe-7d72-11e4-b927-00144feabdc0.html#axzz3PvrlYBCq|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[Financial Times]]''|date=6 December 2014}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2014-12-18|18 December}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend the [[European Council]] which focused on investment in Europe and the [[War in Donbass]].<ref>http://data.consilium.europa.eu/doc/document/ST-237-2014-INIT/en/pdf</ref> |}
== 2015 == [[File:Normandy format talks in Minsk (February 2015) 03.jpeg|thumb|President François Hollande (second from the right) with the leaders of Belarus, Russia, Germany, and Ukraine at the [[Minsk II|summit meeting]] in [[Minsk]], 11 February 2015]] In 2015, President François Hollande made 45 international trips to 34 different countries. The following were the international trips made by President Hollande during the year: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flag|Switzerland}} |[[Davos]] |{{sort|2015-01-23|23 January}} |In Davos, President Hollande attended the [[World Economic Forum#Annual meeting in Davos|World Economic Forum Annual Meeting]], where he addressed business leaders to fight against [[terrorism]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Molloy|first1=Antonia|title=Davos 2015: French President Francois Hollande calls on business leaders to help fight terrorism|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/news/davos-2015-french-president-francois-hollande-calls-on-business-leaders-to-help-fight-terrorism-9999067.html|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[The Independent]]''|date=23 January 2015}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Saudi Arabia}} |[[Riyadh]] |{{sort|2015-01-24|24 January}} |President Hollande was among several world leaders who flew to Riyadh in order to pay their respects to the late [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah]].<ref>{{cite news|title=World leaders in Saudi Arabia to pay tribute to late king|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-30962740|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[BBC News]]''|date=24 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Obama, world leaders head to Saudi Arabia to offer condolences|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/01/24/us-saudi-succession-idUSKBN0KX0A420150124|accessdate=26 January 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=24 January 2015|location=Riyadh}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Oświęcim]] |{{sort|2015-01-27|27 January}} |President Hollande was among several world leaders attending the commemoration of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp#Evacuation, death marches, and liberation|liberation]] of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande: 70 ans après Auschwitz, "les juifs vivent encore dans la douleur"|url=http://www.lexpress.fr/actualite/societe/hollande-70-ans-apres-auschwitz-les-juifs-vivent-encore-dans-la-douleur_1645027.html|accessdate=4 May 2015|publisher=L'express|language=french}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Ukraine}} |[[Kiev]] |{{sort|2015-02-05|5 February}} |President Hollande, along with [[Germany|German]] [[Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany|Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]], travelled to Kiev in order to meet with [[President of Ukraine|President]] [[Petro Poroshenko]] to discuss peace initiatives on the [[2013–15 Ukrainian crisis]].<ref name="Hollande and Merkel visit Kiev and Moscow">{{cite news|last1=Akkoc|first1=Raziye|title=Ukraine crisis: Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande to fly to Russia - live|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/11392108/Ukraine-crisis-Angela-Merkel-and-Francois-Hollande-to-fly-to-Russia-live.html|accessdate=5 February 2015|publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''|date=5 February 2015}}</ref><ref name="Hollande and Merkel visit Ukraine and Russia">{{cite news|last1=Walker|first1=Shaun|title=Hollande and Merkel to fly to Kiev in new effort to resolve Ukraine crisis|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/feb/05/hollande-merkel-kiev-ukraine-proposal-us|accessdate=5 February 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=5 February 2015|location=Kiev}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Russia}} |[[Moscow]] |{{sort|2015-02-06|6 February}} |After visiting Kiev, President Hollande and German Chancellor Merkel travelled to Moscow in order to meet with [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] to discuss peace initiatives on the [[2013–15 Ukrainian crisis]].<ref name="Hollande and Merkel visit Kiev and Moscow" /><ref name="Hollande and Merkel visit Ukraine and Russia" /> |- |{{flag|Belarus}} |[[Minsk]] |{{sort|2015-02-11|11–12 February}} |President Hollande, along with German Chancellor Merkel, Russian President Putin and Ukrainian President Poroshenko, travelled to Minsk in order to attend a summit regarding the peace initiatives on the [[2013–15 Ukrainian crisis]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jordans|first1=Frank|last2=Lee|first2=Matthew|title=World Leaders Aim To Hold Ukraine Summit In Minsk Wednesday|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/02/08/ukraine-peace-talks_n_6639460.html|accessdate=9 February 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Huffington Post]]''|date=8 February 2015|location=Berlin}}</ref> {{further|Minsk II}} |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2015-02-12|12 February}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels in order to attend the informal [[European Council]], which focused on [[Ukrainian crisis|Ukraine]], [[terrorism]], and the [[Economic and Monetary Union of the European Union|monetary union]].<ref>http://www.rpfrance.eu/reunion-du-conseil-europeen-12</ref> |- |{{flag|Philippines}} |[[Manila]], [[Guiuan, Eastern Samar|Guiuan]] |{{sort|2015-02-26|26–27 February}} |President Hollande arrived in Manila on Thursday, 26 February, as part of a two-day state visit, becoming the first French [[head of state]] to visit the Philippines. Upon arrival at [[Villamor Air Base]], he was welcomed by [[Vice President of the Philippines|Vice President]] [[Jejomar Binay]] and [[Secretary of Foreign Affairs (Philippines)|Foreign Secretary]] [[Albert del Rosario]], before attending a wreath-laying ceremony at the [[Rizal Monument]] in [[Rizal Park]]. At the ceremony, Hollande was awarded the "[[Freedom of the City#Key to the City|Key to the City]]" by [[Mayor of Manila|Manila Mayor]] [[Joseph Estrada]].<ref>{{cite web|title=French President Hollande begins two-day state visit, lays wreath at Rizal monument|url=http://news.pia.gov.ph/article/view/1781424941728/french-president-hollande-begins-two-day-state-visit-lays-wreath-at-rizal-monument|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)]]|accessdate=26 February 2015|date=26 February 2015}}</ref>
The president and his delegation, consisting of French actresses [[Marion Cotillard]] and [[Mélanie Laurent]], English actor [[Jeremy Irons]], Executive Secretary [[Christiana Figueres]] of the [[UN Framework Convention on Climate Change]], and [[Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople|Ecumenical Patriarch]] [[Bartholomew I of Constantinople]],<ref>{{cite news|title=France's Hollande in Manila for climate push|url=http://gulfnews.com/news/world/philippines/france-s-hollande-in-manila-for-climate-push-1.1463127|accessdate=26 February 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Gulf News]]''|date=26 February 2015}}</ref> attended a forum at the [[National Museum of the Philippines]] to address global efforts against climate change, before attending a similar business forum in [[Makati]], hosted by business leaders of the [[Makati Business Club]] and the Philippines-France Business Council.<ref name="Inquirer">{{cite news|last1=Avendaño|first1=Christine O.|title=France's Hollande starts two-day visit|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/118996/france-hollande-starts-two-day-visit/|accessdate=26 February 2015|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]''|date=26 February 2015|location=Manila}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Diola|first1=Camille|title=Hollande sees Philippines as major tourist destination|url=http://www.philstar.com/business/2015/02/26/1427896/hollande-sees-philippines-major-tourist-destination|accessdate=26 February 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=26 February 2015|location=Manila}}</ref>
Later that afternoon, President Hollande met with [[President of the Philippines|President]] [[Benigno Aquino III]] at the [[Malacañang Palace]] to discuss climate change and other global and regional issues, including [[terrorism]], in light of the [[Charlie Hebdo shooting|''Charlie Hebdo'' shooting]], during an expanded bilateral meeting,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=French president arrives in Malacañang for Aquino meeting|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/02/26/1427894/french-president-arrives-malacanang-aquino-meeting|accessdate=26 February 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=26 February 2015|location=Manila}}</ref> before launching an agreement, entitled "Manila Call to Action on Climate Change."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Calonzo|first1=Andreo|title=Hollande pays courtesy call on PNoy, to push for climate action|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/443061/news/nation/hollande-pays-courtesy-call-on-pnoy-to-push-for-climate-action|accessdate=26 February 2015|publisher=''[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]''|date=26 February 2015}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino hosted a [[state dinner]] for President Hollande.<ref name="Inquirer" />
On Friday, 27 February, President Hollande paid a short visit to [[Guiuan, Eastern Samar|Guiuan]], [[Eastern Samar]], a [[Municipalities of the Philippines|municipality]] devastated by [[Typhoon Haiyan]] in November 2013. In Guiuan, the president and his delegation met with local fishermen who were victimized by the typhoon, toured the ruins of a local church, and delivered a speech at the Guiuan East Central School.<ref>{{cite news|title=France's Hollande visits typhoon-hit Philippine town|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-2971064/Frances-Hollande-heads-typhoon-hit-Philippine-town.html|accessdate=27 February 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=27 February 2015}}</ref> President Hollande also announced a [[Euro|€]]1.5 million aid to help communities prone to typhoon devastation through the [[Agency for Technical Cooperation and Development]].<ref>{{cite news|title=France's Hollande visits 'Yolanda'-hit Eastern Samar town|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/119073/frances-hollande-visits-yolanda-hit-eastern-samar-town/|accessdate=11 March 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]''|date=27 February 2015|location=Guiuan}}</ref> Upon returning to Manila, Hollande met with the French community at the [[French School of Manila]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande says PHL a prime example for climate change awareness|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/443909/news/nation/hollande-says-phl-a-prime-example-for-climate-change-awareness|accessdate=27 December 2015|work=[[GMA News Online]]|publisher=[[GMA Network Inc.]]|date=27 February 2015}}</ref> before leaving the country later that afternoon.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cruz|first1=RG|title=French President Hollande leaves Manila|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/02/27/15/french-president-hollande-leaves-manila|accessdate=27 December 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=28 February 2015}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Spain}} [[Spain]] |[[Madrid]] |{{sort|2015-03-04|4 March}} |President Hollande met with [[Prime Minister of Spain|Prime Minister]] [[Mariano Rajoy]] during a summit with Spain, [[Portugal]] and the European Commission on energy.<ref>http://www.ambafrance-es.org/Sommet-tripartite-sur-les</ref> |- |{{flag|Luxembourg}} |[[Luxembourg (city)|Luxembourg City]] |{{sort|2015-03-06|6 March}} |President Hollande travelled to Luxembourg on a state visit to meet with [[Henri, Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Grand Duke Henri]] and [[List of Prime He urged Prime Minister Bettel to battle [[tax avoidance]], in light of the [[Luxembourg Leaks]]. In Luxembourg, President Hollande also announced France's €8 billion contribution to [[European Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]] [[Jean-Claude Juncker]]'s economic == 2016 == [[File:Macri con Hollande1.jpg|thumb|President François Hollande with Argentine President [[Mauricio Macri]] at the [[Casa Rosada]] in [[Buenos Aires]], 24 February 2016]] In 2016, President François Hollande made 37 international trips to 30 different countries. The following were the international trips already made by President Hollande during the year: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flag|India}} |[[Chandigarh]], [[Gurgaon]], [[New Delhi]] |24–26 January |On a state visit to India, President Hollande attended the [[Delhi Republic Day parade]], held along [[Rajpath]] in New Delhi, as the parade's honorary chief guest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Arora|first1=Parthshri|title=French President Francois Hollande to be Chief Guest at Republic Day in India|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/french-president-francois-hollande-to-be-chief-guest-at-republic-day-in-india/1/548808.html|accessdate=27 December 2015|work=[[India Today]]|publisher=[[Living Media]]|date=16 December 2015}}</ref> He met with [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] [[Narendra Modi]] to discuss bilateral cooperation in [[counter-terrorism]], [[nuclear power]] and [[sustainable development]]. The two leaders later signed a deal allowing India's purchase of 36 [[Dassault Rafale]] [[fighter aircraft]] from France.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Chatterjee|first1=Arunava|title=India-France sign deal for purchase of 36 Rafale jets|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/rafale-deal-talks-are-progressing-says-french-president-francois-hollande/1/578937.html|accessdate=22 February 2016|work=[[India Today]]|date=25 January 2016}}</ref> President Hollande and Prime Minister Modi also visited the [[Rock Garden of Chandigarh|Rock Garden]], the Capitol Complex, and the [[Government Museum and Art Gallery, Chandigarh|Government Museum and Art Gallery]] in Sector 10 in Chandigarh and inaugurated the Interim Secretariat of the International Solar Alliance, a [[solar energy]] initiative, at the [http://nise.res.in/ National Institute of Solar Energy] in Gurgaon.<ref>{{cite news|title=India, France united in fight against enemies of humanity: PM Modi|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-news-india/french-president-hollande-arrives-in-chandigarh-will-tour-city-with-pm-modi/|accessdate=22 February 2016|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=26 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Modi, Hollande dedicate International Solar Alliance to the world|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india/modi-hollande-dedicate-international-solar-alliance-to-the-world/story-Tnuekmvwt4VBgzRfGEzxnO.html|accessdate=22 February 2016|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=26 January 2016}}</ref> |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2016-02-18|18–19 February}} |President Hollande travelled to Brussels to attend a [[European Council]] centered on the refugees crisis and on the conditions negotiated with UK before the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-35599279|title=EU referendum: David Cameron 'battling for Britain' at summit|date=18 February 2016|work=BBC News}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Peru}} |[[Lima]] |23–24 February |President Hollande paid a state visit to Peru to meet with [[President of Peru|Peruvian President]] [[Ollanta Humala]], enhance bilateral trade, and promote investment opportunities for French businesses in the [[Economy of Peru|Peruvian economy]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Peru FM: Hollande's visit to set a privileged partnership with Peru|url=http://www.andina.com.pe/Ingles/noticia-peru-fm-hollandes-visit-to-set-a-privileged-partnership-with-peru-600143.aspx|accessdate=25 February 2016|agency=[[Andina (news agency)|Andina]]|date=23 February 2016}}</ref> The two leaders witnessed the signing of around 20 bilateral agreements on [[aerospace]], [[climate change]], [[counter-terrorism]], [[Defense (military)|defense]], and [[illegal drug trade]] and signed a joint declaration allowing for the establishment of a France–Peru [[privileged partnership]].<ref>{{cite news|title=French President Hollande visits Peru, in hope of boosting bilateral trade ties|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2016-02/24/c_135124562.htm|accessdate=25 February 2016|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|date=24 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=France President arrives in Peru|url=http://www.andina.com.pe/ingles/noticia-france-president-arrives-in-peru-600204.aspx|accessdate=25 February 2016|agency=[[Andina (news agency)|Andina]]|date=23 February 2016}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Argentina}} |[[Buenos Aires]] |24–25 February |Upon congratulating [[President of Argentina|Argentine President]] [[Mauricio Macri]] on his victory in the [[Argentine general election, 2015|2015 elections]], President Hollande announced that he will visit Argentina in February to meet with him.<ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande felicitó a Macri por su triunfo y confirmó que vendrá al país en febrero|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1849879-hollande-felicito-a-macri-por-su-triunfo-y-confirmo-que-vendra-al-pais-en-febrero|accessdate=29 November 2015|work=La Nacion|date=29 November 2015|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Mauricio Macri recibe al presidente François Hollande en Casa Rosada|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1873938-el-presidente-frances-franzois-hollande-llego-a-la-argentina|accessdate=24 February 2016|work=La Nacion|date=24 February 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref>
During their meeting at [[Casa Rosada]] in Buenos Aires, the two presidents discussed the [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian refugee crisis]], with Hollande suggesting to Macri that Argentina could assist in dealing with the crisis after commending the country's history with [[Lebanese Argentines|Lebanese]] and [[Syrian Argentines|Syrian immigration]].<ref>{{cite news|title=During an official visit in Argentina, French President Francois Hollande suggests that the South American country could help with the Syrian refugee crisis|url=http://www.dailyjournal.net/view/story/d35aa7ea62e9455a814facd69a5f458f/LT--Argentina-French-President|accessdate=25 February 2016|work=Daily Journal|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=24 February 2016}}</ref> Hollande also paid tribute to the [[Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo]], whose children [[Forced disappearance#Argentina|disappeared]] during Argentina's [[Dirty War]] between the late 1970s and early 80s, by throwing flowers onto the [[Río de la Plata]], where he was joined by the [[Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo]], the organization aimed to find the missing children, and mentioned France's victimization to [[National Reorganization Process|Argentina's military dictatorship]] when "22" of the victims were French.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hollande at ESMA memorial: France aware mass crime committed in Argentina|url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/209493/hollande-at-esma-memorial-france-aware-mass-crime-committed-in-argentina-|accessdate=25 February 2016|work=[[Buenos Aires Herald]]|date=25 February 2016}}</ref> As a fan of [[Association football|football]], he later toured the [[La Bombonera]] stadium with President Macri (a former [[List of Boca Juniors chairmen|chairman]] of [[Boca Juniors]]) and former footballers [[David Trezeguet]] and [[Omar da Fonseca]].<ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande inscrit un penalty en Argentine|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/le-scan-sport/buzz/2016/02/26/27002-20160226ARTFIG00152-francois-hollande-inscrit-un-penalty-en-argentine.php|accessdate=27 February 2016|work=[[Le Figaro]]|date=26 February 2016|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=François Hollande marque un péno dans la mythique Bombonera (mais sans gardien)|url=http://www.20minutes.fr/sport/1794507-20160225-francois-hollande-marque-peno-mythique-bombonera-gardien|accessdate=27 February 2016|work=[[20 minutes (France)|20 minutes]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=25 February 2016|language=French}}</ref> |- |{{flag|Uruguay}} |[[Montevideo]] |25 February |President Hollande paid a six-hour official visit to Uruguay, meeting with [[President
